All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
AlertPopups
Class which handles all pop-up alerts the user may experience.
Appointment
Models appointments pertaining to customer, user, and contact.
AppointmentAccess
Class which provides various means of access to Appointment class, such as retrieving appointment object lists, adding, deleting, and updating Appointment objects, looking up appointments, and converting data from database into Appointment object.
AppointmentController
Controller class which provides control logic for the various components of the Appointments screen, including: adding, updating, selecting, and deleting appointments; viewing all, current month, and current week appointments in a table that directly corresponds to the applicable appointments table from the database (except that date/times are displayed in user's local time); filtering said table by ID or Title; and viewing three relevant reports in a separate form.
AppointmentQueries
Data access class that holds all database query methods pertaining to the Appointment class.
Contact
Models contacts associated with created appointments.
ContactAccess
Class which provides various means of access to Contact class, such as retrieving contact object lists, adding contact objects (at initialization), and looking up contacts.
ContactQueries
Data access class that holds single database query method pertaining to the Contact class.
Country
Models country pertaining to corresponding customer.
CountryAccess
Class which provides various means of access to Country class, such as retrieving Country object lists, adding User objects (at initialization), and looking up countries.
CountryQueries
Data access class that holds single database query method pertaining to the Country class.
Customer
Models customers.
CustomerAccess
Class which provides various means of access to Customer class, such as retrieving customer object lists, adding, deleting, and updating Customer objects, looking up customers, and converting data from database into Customer object.
CustomerController
Controller class which provides control logic for the various components of the Customers screen, including: adding, updating, selecting, and deleting customers; viewing all customers in a table that directly corresponds to the applicable customers table from the database (except that date/times are displayed in user's local time); and filtering table by ID or name.
CustomerQueries
Data access class that holds all database query methods pertaining to the Customer class.
FirstLevelDivision
Models First-Level Divisions.
FLDAccess
Class which provides various means of access to FirstLevelDivision class, such as retrieving first-level division object lists, adding division objects (at initialization), and looking up divisions.
FLDQueries
Data access class that holds all database query methods pertaining to the FirstLevelDivision class.
JDBC
Class that enables manipulation of and interaction with applicable database.
LoginController
Controller class which provides control logic for the components of the Login screen.
Main
The main class from which the application is launched.
ReportsController
Controller class which provides control logic for the various components of the Reports screen.
ReportsQueries
Data access class that holds all database query methods pertaining to the Reports page.
SceneChanger
Utility class that handles screen changes.
TimeHelper
Utility class that handles various date and time matters, including conversions, lists of times in necessary data types, and comparing dates and times.
Translation
Class that handles text translation for English and French.
User
Models Users who log in to application.
UserAccess
Class which provides various means of access to User class, such as retrieving User object lists, adding User objects (at initialization), and looking up users.
UserQueries
Data access class that holds single database query method pertaining to the User class.
WelcomeController
Controller class which provides control logic for the components of the Welcome screen.
